channel.title: Unweighted Shortest Paths :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Unweighted Shortest Paths In some shortest path problems, all edges have the same length. For example, we may be trying to find the shortest path out of a maze. Each cell in the maze is a node, and an edge connects two nodes if we can move between them in a single step. In this problem, we simply want to minimize the number of edges in a path to an exit.
